claim.text: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon, provided they are allowed accommodation space.
claim.exact_quote: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon (medium confidence), provided they are allowed accommodation space.

evidence.evidence_text: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon, provided they are allowed accommodation space.
evidence.limitations: Confidence is medium; specific quantification of carbon sequestration or livelihood support is not provided.
evidence.exact_quote: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon (medium confidence), provided they are allowed accommodation space.

conclusion.limitations: Lacks specific examples or data on livelihood support or carbon sequestration amounts.

claim.text: Inclusive water regimes that include wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, with synergies for ecosystem conservation and disaster risk reduction, are more successful for adaptation and sustainable development.
claim.type: Novel finding on water regimes and wetland restoration
claim.exact_quote: Inclusive water regimes that overcome social inequalities and approaches including nature-based solutions, such as wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, with synergies for ecosystem conservation and disaster risk reduction, have been found to be more successful for adaptation and sustainable development (high confidence).

evidence.evidence_text: Inclusive water regimes that overcome social inequalities and approaches including nature-based solutions, such as wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, with synergies for ecosystem conservation and disaster risk reduction, have been found to be more successful for adaptation and sustainable development.
evidence.limitations: Evidence is based on identified successful cases; may not generalize across all contexts.
evidence.exact_quote: Inclusive water regimes that overcome social inequalities and approaches including nature-based solutions, such as wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, with synergies for ecosystem conservation and disaster risk reduction, have been found to be more successful for adaptation and sustainable development (high confidence).

conclusion.limitations: Generalized claim without specific examples of successful inclusive water regimes.

claim.text: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of intertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR.
claim.type: Claim on coastal wetland management and sea level rise
claim.exact_quote: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of intertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR (high confidence).

evidence.evidence_text: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of intertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR, with small, shallow microtidal estuaries being more vulnerable to impacts than deeper estuaries with well-developed sediments.
evidence.limitations: High confidence in the transformation and loss, but medium confidence in vulnerability variation between estuary types.
evidence.location: WGII 3 Ocean and coastal ecosystems and their services 3.4
evidence.exact_quote: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of intertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR (high confidence)... with small, shallow microtidal estuaries being more vulnerable to impacts than deeper estuaries with well-developed sediments (medium confidence).

conclusion.limitations: Specific impacts on different types of estuaries could benefit from more detailed elaboration.

claim.text: Coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1.
claim.type: Technical potential of coastal wetland restoration
claim.exact_quote: There is medium confidence that coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 (0.04–0.84) gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 (0.05–0.2) gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1.

evidence.evidence_text: Coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 (0.04–0.84) gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 (0.05–0.2) gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1.
evidence.limitations: Confidence is medium and ranges of potential are broad, indicating significant uncertainty.
evidence.exact_quote: There is medium confidence that coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 (0.04–0.84) gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 (0.05–0.2) gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1.

conclusion.limitations: Provides a range without explaining the causes of variation.

claim.text: Coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and restoration will mostly likely reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates.
claim.type: Finding on carbon stocks in coastal wetlands
claim.exact_quote: There is high confidence that coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and medium confidence that restoration will reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates.

evidence.evidence_text: Coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and restoration will reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates.
evidence.limitations: High confidence in carbon stock presence; medium confidence about reinstating sequestration rates.
evidence.exact_quote: There is high confidence that coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and medium confidence that restoration will reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates.

conclusion.limitations: Assumes restoration always leads to reinstating pre-disturbance rates without addressing potential challenges.

claim.text: The response of coastal wetlands to climate change is uncertain; however, coastal wetland restoration will provide a suite of valuable co-benefits.
claim.type: Claim on coastal wetland restoration co-benefits
claim.exact_quote: There is low confidence on the response of coastal wetlands to climate change; however, there is high confidence that coastal wetland restoration will provide a suite of valuable co-benefits.

evidence.evidence_text: The response of coastal wetlands to climate change is uncertain; however, coastal wetland restoration will provide a suite of valuable co-benefits.
evidence.limitations: Low confidence regarding the response to climate change, but high confidence in the co-benefits provided.
evidence.exact_quote: There is low confidence on the response of coastal wetlands to climate change; however, there is high confidence that coastal wetland restoration will provide a suite of valuable co-benefits.

conclusion.limitations: Broad and uncertain with no details on the nature of co-benefits.
